required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physiological-based Cord Clamping in Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia
clinical_study.official_title: Physiological-based Cord Clamping Versus Immediate Cord Clamping for Infants Born With Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia: a Multicentre, Randomised Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Pulmonary hypertension is a major determinant of postnatal survival in infants with a congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH). The current care during the perinatal stabilisation period in infants born with this rare birth defect might contribute to the development of pulmonary hypertension after birth - in particular umbilical cord clamping before lung aeration. An ovine model of diaphragmatic hernia demonstrated that cord clamping after lung aeration, called physiological-based cord clamping (PBCC), avoided the initial high pressures in the lung vasculature while maintaining adequate blood flow, thereby avoiding vascular remodelling and aggravation of pulmonary hypertension. The investigators aim to investigate if the implementation of PBCC in the perinatal stabilisation period of infants born with a CDH could reduce the incidence of pulmonary hypertension in the first 24 hours after birth.
The investigators will perform a multicentre, randomised controlled trial in infants with an isolated CDH. Before birth, infants will be randomised to either PBCC or immediate cord clamping, stratified by treatment centre and severity of pulmonary hypoplasia on antenatal ultrasound. For performing PBCC a purpose-designed resuscitation module (the Concord Birth Trolley) will be used.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with pulmonary hypertension diagnosed in the first 24 hours after birth.
primary_outcome.description: Pulmonary hypertension is present if at least 2 of the following 4 criteria are present or if the infant requires extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) in the first 24 hours after birth: Right ventricular systolic pressure (RVSP) ≥2/3 systemic systolic pressure* Right ventricle (RV) dilatation/septal displacement or RV dysfunction +/- left ventricle (LV) dysfunction* Pre-post ductal SpO2 difference >10%** Oxygenation Index >20** *as found on first ultrasound in first 24 hours after birth; **highest values measures in first 24 hours after birth The following echocardiographic parameters will be collected to objectify these criteria: RV size Pulmonary artery acceleration time (PAAT), right ventricular ejection time (RVET), PAAT:RVET ratio Intraventricular septum configuration LV systolic eccentricity index Mean airway pressure PaO2 FiO2 Preductal+postductal SpO2

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: umbilical cord pH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: type and characteristics of respiratory support in the delivery room
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the delivery room, meaning immediately after birth until transport to the intensive care unit.
secondary_outcome.description: Intubation yes/no; high frequency oscillatory ventilation yes/no; conventional mechanical ventilation yes/no.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients with early-onset sepsis or late-onset sepsis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first, assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Culture proven sepsis

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors with early-onset sepsis or late-onset sepsis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Culture proven sepsis

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients with hyperbilirubinemia requiring phototherapy or exchange transfusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first, assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with hyperbilirubinemia requiring phototherapy or exchange transfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors with hyperbilirubinemia requiring phototherapy or exchange transfusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of survivors with hyperbilirubinemia requiring phototherapy or exchange transfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients requiring fluid therapy or inotropes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first, assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients requiring fluid therapy (amount and frequency) or inotropes (adrenalin, dobutamine, dopamine, milrinone, noradrenalin, vasopressin)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors requiring fluid therapy or inotropes in the first 72 hours of admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home, assessed up to 72 hours after birth.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of survivors requiring fluid therapy (amount and frequency) or inotropes (adrenalin, dobutamine, dopamine, milrinone, noradrenalin, vasopressin)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients requiring oxygen on day 28 (BPD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The presence of BPD is evaluated on day 28 (after birth); the severity is evaluated on day 56 (after birth) or at discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of BPD and severity (mild, moderate, severe, not classified)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors requiring oxygen on day 28 (BPD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The presence of BPD is evaluated on day 28 (after birth); the severity is evaluated on day 56 (after birth) or at discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of BPD and severity (mild, moderate, severe, not classified)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients with pulmonary hypertension on day 7, 14, 21, 28, and at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first, assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of clinically relevant pulmonary hypertension requiring therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors with pulmonary hypertension on day 7, 14, 21, 28, and at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of clinically relevant pulmonary hypertension requiring therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients surviving to discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth till discharge home
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients surviving to discharge home

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients requiring ECMO therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients requiring ECMO therapy; number of infants with complications during ECMO therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors requiring ECMO therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home
secondary_outcome.description: Number of survivors requiring ECMO therapy; number of survivors with complications during ECMO therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients requiring pulmonary vasodilators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients requiring pulmonary vasodilators (number of days) (sildenafil, prostaglandin E, bosentan, prostacyclins, milrinone, iNO)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors requiring pulmonary vasodilators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home
secondary_outcome.description: Number of survivors requiring pulmonary vasodilators (number of days) (sildenafil, prostaglandin E, bosentan, prostacyclins, milrinone, iNO)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients with cerebral complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with cerebral complications (haemorrhage, infarction)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors with cerebral complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home
secondary_outcome.description: Number of survivors with cerebral complications (haemorrhage, infarction)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of patients with surgery for CDH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients receiving surgery for CDH (day of surgery, use of patch, surgical approach, defect size)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of survivors with surgery for CDH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge home
secondary_outcome.description: Number of survivors receiving surgery for CDH (day of surgery, use of patch, surgical approach, defect size)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of days of patients on intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge to another ward or home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days of admission to the intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: number of days of survivors on intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of discharge to another ward or home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days of admission to the intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: type and characteristics of respiratory support during admission of patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the date of death or the date of discharge home, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days: needing supplemental oxygen, on mechanical ventilation, on NIPPV/NIV, on CPAP/high flow >2L, on low flow ≤2L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: type and characteristics of respiratory support during admission of survivors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the ICU until the the date of discharge home
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days: needing supplemental oxygen, on mechanical ventilation, on NIPPV/NIV, on CPAP/high flow >2L, on low flow ≤2L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal: echocardiographig parameters on first ultrasound in the first 24 hours after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth till 24 hours afterwards
secondary_outcome.description: Tricuspid regurgitation, peak flow velocity of tricuspid regurgitation, tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion, RV systolic to diastolic duration ratio, transductal shunting direction and peak flow velocity, interatrial shunting direction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal: number of patients with postpartum haemorrhage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first 24 hours after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Postpartum haemorrhage is defined as estimated blood loss >1000 mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal: number of patients with a surgical site infection requiring antibiotic treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the first week after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: After caesarean section

arm_group.description: In PBCC, the Concord will be placed next to the bed of the mother and all equipment will be checked before the second stage of labour has started. The infant will be placed on the platform of the Concord immediately after birth, avoiding any traction or pressure on the cord and avoiding heat loss by radiation heating. The umbilical cord will not be clamped until the infant is considered respiratory stable, which is defined as the presence of a heart rate >100 bpm and preductal oxygen saturation >85%, while using an fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) of <0.5. The minimum and maximum times of cord clamping are three and ten minutes after birth, respectively. Oxytocin administration will be postponed until after cord clamping if there are no obstetric concerns. At any time, the attending neonatologist and obstetrician can decide that PBCC should not be performed or be interrupted. In that case, the infant can be placed on the standard resuscitation table for (further) stabilisation.

In the immediate cord clamping group, the cord will be clamped immediately after birth. The infant will then be transferred to the standard neonatal resuscitation table. After cord clamping, all infants will be managed according to the standardised neonatal management protocol for infants with a CDH, which is a consensus of current clinical guidelines by the CDH EURO consortium.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Left-sided CDH
- Isolated CDH: no associated structural or genetic abnormalities that are diagnosed before birth
- Gestational age at delivery ≥35.0 weeks
- Parental written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Right-sided or bilateral CDH
- Gestational age at delivery <35.0 weeks
- Maternal contraindications: anterior placenta praevia, placental abruption
- High urgency caesarean section, with intended interval to delivery <15 min
- Cases that have been treated during pregnancy with experimental drug therapy aiming to decrease the occurrence of pulmonary hypertension
- Twin pregnancies in which the infant diagnosed with a CDH is born first
- Multiple birth >2 (triplets or higher order)

facility.name: Erasmus MC University Medical Center - Sophia Children's Hospital
